Class: ExportOptionsJPEG

ExportOptionsJPEG

new ExportOptionsJPEG()

Options for exporting a document as a JPEG file, used with the exportFile method. All properties are optional. When you export a document, the appropriate file extension is appended automatically. You should not include any file extension in the file specification.
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 6

Members

antiAliasing :boolean

If true, the exported image should be anti-aliased. Default: true
Type:
  • boolean
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 12

artBoardClipping :boolean

If true, the exported image should be clipped to the art board.
Type:
  • boolean
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 18

blurAmount :number

The amount of blur to apply to the exported image. Range: 0.0 to 2.0. Default: 0.0 (double)
Type:
  • number
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 24

horizontalScale :number

The horizontal scaling factor to apply to the exported image, where 100.0 is 100%. Default: 100.0 (double)
Type:
  • number
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 30

matte :boolean

If true, the art board should be matted with a color. Default: true
Type:
  • boolean
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 35

matteColor :RGBColor

The color to use when matting the art board. Default: white
Type:
  • RGBColor
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 41

optimization :boolean

If true, the exported image should be optimized for web viewing. Default: true
Type:
  • boolean
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 46

qualitySetting :number

The quality of the exported image. Range: 0 to 100. Default: 30 (long)
Type:
  • number
Source:
  • ExportOptionsJPEG.js, line 52

saveAsHTML :boolean

If true, the exported image should be saved with an accompanying HTML file. Default: false
Type:
  • boolean

The vertical scaling factor to apply to the exported image. Range: 0.0 to 776.19. Default: 100.0 (double)
